alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 10:23PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM HST SUNDAY FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 130 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1019 PM HST, Radar indicated heavy rain over the windward slopes of Haleakala. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Additional heavy rainfall is expected to move onshore in the next several hours. Some rainfall will spread into Upcountry Maui and the Kaupo region. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kahului, Kihei, Kula, Keokea, Pukalani, Makawao, Keanae, Haliimaile, Kipahulu, Kaupo, Huelo, Haiku-Pauwela, Nahiku, Ulupalakua, Wailea, Pauwela, Paia, Makena, Puunene and Hana. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 130 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. A Flood Watch is also in effect for Maui County until 600pm HST Sunday.
